details: The scheme "Old Age Samman Allowance" is a social security scheme implemented by the Department of Social Justice and Empowerment, Government of Haryana. The scheme provides a pension of ₹3,000/- per month to senior citizens (60 years or above) who are unable to sustain themselves with their own resources.
eligibility: The applicant should be 60 years or above in age.
The applicant should be domiciled in and a resident of Haryana.
The income of the applicant, from all sources, including that of their spouse, should not exceed ₹3,00,000/- per annum.
exclusions: Notwithstanding the above, any person receiving a pension from any Government or Local/ Statutory Body or any organization substantially financed by any Government or Local/ Statutory Body will not be eligible to receive allowance under the scheme.
application_process: Online application through Antyodaya SARAL Portal.
Offline application through Atal Seva Kendra.
documents_required: Age Proof (any one of the following): Birth Certificate, School Certificate, Voter Card, Name of the applicant in the voter’s list showing a photograph.
Residential Proof (any one of the following self-attested documents, issued prior to 15 years): Ration Card, Voter Card, Name of the applicant in the voter’s list showing a photograph.
Other Documents: Aadhaar Card (optional), Saving Bank account details of the applicant with a photocopy of the passbook, Family ID of the applicant.
